snippet: Monday marked the first day of so-called “fairness hearings” in the long-running case against the New York Fire Department, accused of discriminating against minority applicants.
abstract: First day of so-called 'fairness hearings' in long-running case accusing the New York Fire Department of discriminating against minority applicants begins; hearings are intended to give people who are not themselves plaintiffs or defendants in the case an opportunity to weigh in; testimony generally falls into two camps--white firefighters who are already on the force, and minority applicants--and is largely predictable.
lead_paragraph: Monday marked the first day of so-called “fairness hearings” in the long-running case against the New York Fire Department, accused of discriminating against minority applicants.
